title: binaural beat tripped out nonverbal ambient FSOL and Eno.
description:
I've taken advantage of my unemployment period by doing a full
.wav PCM 44.1 16bit remastering of Brian Eno's big ambient hits
and also the entire FSOL (Future Sound of London) ambient catalog.
I added transparent binaural beats with 20 resonators at
frequencies of 4-5, 8-9, 16-17, and 32-33 applied randomly across
the tracks... meaning, by shuffling through the .mp3s (finally
encoded at highest quality VBR) you can literally 'trip' without
application of corrosive substances to your body. On the DVD i've
also included my main 'ramping' meditation track,
'anchorless06.mp3'... It's
pretty cool stuff, i mean *getting high from your iPod or similar
device*...

binaural beat headphone meditation ultimate brian
eno and fsol (future sound of london) ambient trip out mix use
headphones, not while driving, not for epileptics

this is a sample, but the whole DVD is
165 files - 1.47 Gb ~ 233 KBps
all Future Sound of London (all tracks in their catalog),
plus notable ambient albums from Brian Eno (music for airports,
ambient 4 on land, etc...)

the binaural effect was distributed randomly across the files:
---
1/4 of the files have a 4-5 Hz transparent binaural beat applied
(sedation, closed eye visuals)
1/4 of the files have an 8-9 Hz transparent binaural beat applied
(meditative reflection, DMT-like closed eye visuals)
1/4 of the files have a 16-17 Hz transparent binaural beat applied
(somewhat stimulatory, somewhat meditative reflective)
1/4 of the files have a 32-33 Hz transparent binaural beat applied
(very hyper-stimulatory/anxious, perhaps outside the range of
binaural beat mood modification possibilities)

anchorless07 is a generic binaural beat meditation file using five
tones only, from bwgen.exe. the '06' version is better than the
'03' version, because it has periodic right-for left- ear
switching built-in (to defeat acclimation)
